intro: Mesembryanthemum reptans, commonly known as the carpetweed or sandmat, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves and showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often forming dense mats on the ground. Its flowers, which open in response to sunlight, are typically pale yellow or pink, and they bloom in the morning. Mesembryanthemum reptans is well adapted to hot, dry conditions and is often used in xeriscaping due to its low maintenance requirements.
